alert.note: Alert for De Baca County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 5:13PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL DE BACA COUNTY THROUGH 545 PM MDT... At 513 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles southeast of Yeso, or 18 miles southwest of Fort Sumner, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central De Baca County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
